extension.name: Content - PopFeed
extension.author: Christopher Mavros
extension.copyright: Copyright (C) 2011 Christopher Mavros. All rights reserved.
extension.description: PopFeed - Complete Article Feedback Functionality, popping out of your site!

field.name: auto_all
field.label: Auto Include PopFeed
field.description: This is an option to automatically include PopFeed in every article. If this is No, to include PopFeed in an article you write {popfeed}Leave your Feedback (or whatever else text in here){/popfeed}

field.name: auto_recipient
field.label: Auto Recipient
field.description: This is an option to automatically retrieve the email recipient from the article's author

field.name: email_recipient
field.label: Email Recipient
field.description: The recipient of the feedback message.

field.name: popfeed_appearance
field.label: PopFeed Form Appearance
field.description: This is an option to set how will the PopFeed form appear.
field.option: Using jQuery ColorBox Plugin, as a popup in the middle. (default)
No external libraries. Just popup PopFeed in the middle.
Using jQuery, sliding below the PopFeed link.
No external libraries. Just slide PopFeed below the link.
No external libraries. Form is always visible.

field.name: include_external_libraries
field.label: Include JS Libraries
field.description: This is an option to choose whether or not to load external libraries. Please note that this will override any setting in the Form Appearance option, if they do not comply.

field.name: include_css
field.label: Include PopFeed.css file
field.description: This is an option to choose whether or not to load the popfeed.css file. Some functionalities may not work without this file.

field.name: link_position
field.label: Link Position
field.description: Where to show the PopFeed link. As a normal link within text, or fixed somewhere on the page.

field.name: link_vertical
field.label: Link Vertical Position
field.description: Where to position the fixed form link vertically

field.name: link_horizontal
field.label: Link Horizontal Position
field.description: Where to position the fixed form link horizontally

field.name: pre_text
field.label: Form Pre-Text
field.description: Some HTML enabled text, shown before the form.

field.name: auto_subject
field.label: Auto Subject
field.description: This is an option to automatically retrieve the subject from the article's title

field.name: auto_subject_pattern
field.label: Auto Subject Pattern
field.description: A pattern based on which the subject is pre-filled. Use %s to include the article title.

field.name: use_captcha
field.label: Use Captcha
field.description: This is an option to choose whether or not to include the site captcha plugin in the form.

field.name: show_in_frontpage
field.label: Show in Frontpage
field.description: This is an option to show in the front-page articles, or not.

field.name: show_in_blog
field.label: Show in Blog Layout
field.description: This is an option to show in blog layout articles, or not.

field.name: catids
field.label: Filter Categories
field.description: This is an option to include PopFeed, only in articles of the specified categories.

field.name: excluded_ids
field.label: Exclude IDs
field.description: Use this option if you want to exclude PopFeed from some article IDs. Example: 1,2,3

field.name: htmlentities_in_email
field.label: HTML Entities in Email
field.description: Whether or not you want to apply the HTML Entities PHP Filter in the message, before sending.

field.name: fixed_url
field.label: Fixed URL
field.description: A simple solution for people that want to use PopFeed in an exact page. Change this to Yes and write the URL of PopFeed in the Fixed URL Address parameter

field.name: fixed_url_address
field.label: Fixed URL Address
field.description: If fixed url is true, this address is used for PopFeed to post the form.
